website_summaries.verdict: The fit may be snug, but the double layer design provides dry heat retention. Ideal for outdoor workers, motorcyclists and skiers.
pros: Can be doubled for additional insulation
Also protects ears, mouth and nose
cons: Neck fit is tighter than expected
Material can shed and fall apart at seams
Breathability is an issue for some users

customer_reviews.title: It's made in China.
customer_reviews.text: It's rather tight around my size 17.5 neck (shirt collar size). Hope it stretches instead of shrinks! Decent quality and good "softness. It is however MADE IN CHINA. Why do manufacturers write nonsense like this on their tags? "Turtle Fur is the iconic Vermont brand.Located in Morrisville and nestled in the beautiful Green Mountains of Vermont, Turtle Fur was born in the shadows of Mount Mansfield. " It's made in China.
customer_reviews.author: Anom Pen-Name

customer_reviews.title: Wast of money!
customer_reviews.text: Poor poor quality! -- take a look at the picture.
customer_reviews.author: Mohammed U.

customer_reviews.title: I love it! I completely forgot how soft they are
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had one of these since I was a kid, so I ordered one from Amazon. I love it! I completely forgot how soft they are; this is NOT the kind of fleece you get on generic products. The fleece is very high quality, dense, incredibly soft, and absolutely no wind penetrates it. It's thick (double layered) and tight enough that I can pull it up over my nose and it stays put to keep my face warm. I really really really hate being cold, so I love this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Mallory

customer_reviews.title: Easy care instructions
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for a snowboard trip in temps ranging from 2-32. And here was my experience: PROS: Well made and seemingly durable. Very very warm and very soft. The color is what I expected it to be (black, so hard to mess that up). Easy care instructions. Good size for what it is and will cover face, neck, and most of ears. CONS: Bulky hard to combine with high zipping jackets or helmet straps. Not waterproof on the outside (not advertised to be), so it got wet once my ice beard melted. There was LOTS of snow.
customer_reviews.author: ____Top Contributor: Guitars

customer_reviews.title: Purchased this in sapphire. But when you click on ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this in sapphire. But when you click on the picture there are 2 different colors that appear. The one that had arrived was what I would describe as turquoise. I’ve enclosed a picture - it’s slightly darker than the picture. It’s big enough to fit an iPad horizontally inside. I didn’t have anything else to display it with as my cats had declined. I can’t wait to try it out next month when I travel to Canada.
customer_reviews.author: gennuhfurr

customer_reviews.title: Great for Motorcyles, too!
customer_reviews.text: I ride motorcycles where we live in north FL and it gets chilly in the winter. It is cool enough to wear leathers and sweaters but my turtlenecks don't seem to cut the wind between my helmet and jacket collar. I love to layer since it can warm up 30 degrees during a day of riding. These are warm, not too thin, can be doubled to get extra protection and shorten the distance between the chin and collar. Very soft, which is important with all the road vibrations and wind.
customer_reviews.author: JCO

customer_reviews.title: Started to fall apart immediately
customer_reviews.text: The fleece fabric on this started to fall apart after only one or two days of use. (The fleece started balling-up and forming giant "pills," as they are sometimes called. If you want to wear this and you want it to look nice, you are going to have to use a fabric shaver on it every few days or so. That said, I still wear mine almost every day and it does keep me warmer, much like a scarf would. The fabric on mine looks pretty terrible though. Pros: Will keep you warmer Cons: Fabric will look terrible within one or two weeks of use
customer_reviews.author: James Liberty

customer_reviews.title: if you want THICK - this is IT!
customer_reviews.text: rec'd fast - Amazon Prime is SO awesome! - this is THICK. Really, REALLY THICK! We got this for my wife to wear on the Harley in the winter....and it's probably about the only time I could see wearing this...unless I was in a deer stand or duck blind and it was blustery and way below freezing. I'm not saying it's bad - it's GOOD that it's thick...that's what she wanted it for as we have plenty of Buff's both regular and Polar for all the other riding/wearing we do in life....so this is a great option as I doubt ANY wind could get thru this.
customer_reviews.author: solocanoe

customer_reviews.title: Stylist, light weight neck warmer.
customer_reviews.text: I love the style and that this is a warm but light weight neck warmer. It does not feel like I am weighted down or heavily bundled and that I like very much. I live on southeast coast of USA. We do get chilly and windy here but not extremely cold. It kept me comfortable during a recent very windy cold snap into the 30's. As the winter comes and progresses, no doubt I will wear it often. It has a cute style, love the little turtle emblem also. It stretches just right for easy on and off. Happy to purchase a product that gives a free one if I use their hashtag on IG. Great company and product!
customer_reviews.author: DENISE GABRIEL

customer_reviews.title: Way too soft
customer_reviews.text: Turtle fur neck warmers have been my absolute go-to piece of cold weather gear for many years. Utterly indispensable for cold weather. So unfortunately I lost a couple em and so ordered replacements. The good news is the Chelonia 150 is very soft. Bad news is that it is so soft, it tends to roll up or down your face when you move it, rather than sliding as a whole, up and down. Causes it to be actually uncomfortable and much poorer performance than the original, basic TF fleece neck warmer. One iteration of the originals I use is using 2 of them together for double thickness. Flawless function, extremely comfortable, and repels arctic level cold with ease.
customer_reviews.author: nancy l.

customer_reviews.title: Use it on the Motorcycle Everytime I Ride
customer_reviews.text: I love my turtle fur. I wear it every time I ride my motorcycle, winter or summer. In winter, it prevents my neck from getting chilled, helping keep my brain happy. In the summer time, I wet it with water and it cools me via evaporation. I've worn it in weather from 18F to 113F and it's always helped. It's well made, well stitched and durable. It holds up to repeated washes in the washing machine, too. If you don't have one but ride a motorcycle, or ski, or sled, or do any activity where you are outside, get one. They are good.
customer_reviews.author: Robert in Broomfield

customer_reviews.title: Super soft
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing. It feels great just to touch it. Then, putting it on makes it even better. It instantly makes you warmer. Wore this skiing, and didn't feel any wind or bits of snow whatsoever. I'm not the fastest, but the rest of my face was feeling some type of cold. Since it's tall, you can cover your nose/mouth while keeping your neck covered too. You could tuck it under your shirt, but a hoodie or jacket would be a lot more ideal. Definitely can't go wrong picking this out
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Any Day, Any Occasion, Any Fit!!!
customer_reviews.text: Neck, chin and mouth, nose... cover up as much as you want for just the same amount of warmth. This magic material manages not to soak up water when it's raining or snowing. They even can cover my ears! It also stretches when needed but doesn't stay stretched out. When I got my wisdom teeth removed, I ended up using this to help hold the ice on my jaw for about two weeks. When I no longer had the extra ice packs, it still went back to fitting me just as snugly as it did when I first got it. Love the fabric's soft texture and actually want to go get it and wear it now, just writing about it!
customer_reviews.author: Chriss S.

customer_reviews.title: Kept Me Toasty
customer_reviews.text: A friend told me about this item that he used to keep warm, as a football official, I used it during a winter game of wind and pouring rain and kept my neck and ears really ways and out of the way form the elements. My son recently used it for a sledding trip to the snow and kept him warm all day while in the snow. very nice material, easy to clean and best of all keeps you warm.
customer_reviews.author: John J Cattolico

customer_reviews.title: Seam began to rip after 2 weeks of moderate use
customer_reviews.text: As the title says, the main seam has started to rip after moderate use for two weeks. I don't even wear it every day. It's a nice product, but I can't recommend it to anyone who doesn't feel like rolling the dice on having to replace it inside of a single month. There are other manufacturers out there; I suggest you pass this one by and try them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do not recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if this is proper English - the warmer is pilling a lot. All my clothes, my hair (when I remove it) are in the lint. And, this is only after 2 days of skiing! Going to the ski shop to buy one. This one is going back!
customer_reviews.author: Stan

customer_reviews.title: Soft and feels great but...
customer_reviews.text: Good fit, soft material, comfortable. But it sheds lint like crazy. The photo shows wht the inside of the warmer was like after wearing for two hours. I took it off 3 times in a 6 hour period and the lint balls were this bad or worse. Disappointed because this was the first time i wore it. Not confident it will last very long at this rate.
customer_reviews.author: James Miller

customer_reviews.title: Kept me warm in below freezing temps
customer_reviews.text: This neck warmer kept me warm on a below-freezing snow-shoeing adventure in Glacier National Park in the middle of March. It held up in all the flurrying of snow to my face. It was not stifling or uncomfortable or too warm in my experience and will be a staple for future winter adventures.
customer_reviews.author: Z

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic but tag a bit annoying
customer_reviews.text: I have several Turtle Fur neck warmers and they are all great. Taking off one star due to the newer logo tag. The tag is rounded save for one corner. That one pointed corner always seems to find my cheek or neck and is sharp. Doesn’t stop me from wearing it, but I may try to snip the corner to blunt the tip.
customer_reviews.author: B. Ormond

customer_reviews.title: Pretty!
customer_reviews.text: Nice thickness and soft. A little snug but I’ll be thankful when cold weather hits and the wind can’t get thru! I really love this!
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing. Very versatile. Where it around your neck or over your face. Easy to pull down if you gotta talk to someone. Ordered one for work. Will be ordering another for home
customer_reviews.author: Dray Emerson

customer_reviews.title: Love it, love it, love it!
customer_reviews.text: Fits to cover your mouth, nose, ears and neck. Super warm, soft and stretches well. Got two then bought more for the whole family. When it's super cold having nose and mouth protection for your lungs and ear protection from frostbite is a must. Makes a great inexpensive Christmas gift. I can't wait to use mine! It's going to be a COLD winter. : )
customer_reviews.author: M Mason

customer_reviews.title: Must have neck warmer!
customer_reviews.text: This is just what I was looking for, this brand is of the highest quality, and so warm, and snuggly, keeping my neck warm when I am running. Neck goiters are perfect for active people, while keeping you warm, and whicking away excess moisture! I am so glad I purchased this. There is a reason why this product has so many amazing reviews! Quality, soft, durable material, I hope it washes well! Turtle fur is the best on the market for neck fleece warmers, must have for winter! Keep your neck warm!
customer_reviews.author: Bflyrenee

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the cold out
customer_reviews.text: I actually bought this for my teenage son...he loves it! It keeps the cold air from blowing down his coat when his hood isn't on, and keeps his neck and ears nice and toasty! This is an unknown item here in Mississippi, but it's been cold lately and now everyone on his bus wants one!
customer_reviews.author: Christina Williamson

customer_reviews.title: Warm and soft
customer_reviews.text: I think this thing is great. It's very soft and very warm but you can still breath with it on. Only issue I have is that the stitching was already torn when I got the product. I am handy with a needle so I fixed it myself, but I was a bit disappointed to know it was already broken before ei even got it.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan Hicks

customer_reviews.title: Bought as a gift
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my husband who has a normal sized neck. He said it was a bit tight. Not unbearable, he still wears it but he said he would have liked it to be just a bit looser on his neck. Otherwise, he was very pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: D. Clark

customer_reviews.title: It feels more like wool than fleece
customer_reviews.text: How unusual. I purchased both the black and the charcoal neck warmers but the charcoal one has a significantly rougher texture. It feels more like wool than fleece. It is also not as stretchy as the black gaiter, it was much more difficult to get around my hair (bad hair days with this...). I wonder why there's such variation in the two colors? I'd rate this a 3/5. The same neck warmer in black as a 5/5.
customer_reviews.author: (: allie

customer_reviews.title: Indespensible for years of Winter Warmth!
customer_reviews.text: Bought in 5 colors for members of my family to keep them warm. I've had mine for years and it has retained its shape and stretch. Washes great, no pilling. Really makes a huge difference in staying warm in the winter in New England. Indespensible.
customer_reviews.author: maryanne

customer_reviews.title: but it's great for commutes to work
customer_reviews.text: This neck warmer has been a steal of a purchase. It has basically taken the place of my decently sized scarf collection. Whenever I really need to be warm quickly, I pick this for utility. Of course, it's not my pick for matching with a suit or dressing up otherwise, but it's great for commutes to work, great for walking during the winter, and highly warm. It also has been the best neck warmer I've owned in terms of not gathering condensation from breath - that may have to do with the two layers. It covers my admittedly very long neck fairly well. TL;DR Definitely warm, comfortable and quality fleece and seams. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Would be a great product if it didn't shed :-(
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this product. When it arrived in the mail we were going through a cold snap, and I was excited to try it out. It's light, soft, comfortable, warm, and breathable. Sad to say, when I got to work, I found to my embarrassment that my neck and head - I also purchased a Turtle Fur hat - were covered with black fibers and dustballs. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Strong

customer_reviews.title: Ripped at the seam after a month
customer_reviews.text: So I got this for my 5 year old and I was really disappointed in the quality. At first it was nice but it ripped at the seam after a month of use. We sewed it back up, but for the price I’d expect something to last a little longer.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsey

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for warm neck and face
customer_reviews.text: Very soft and very, very warm. I'm a pretty big guy and still able to put this over my face without it being uncomfortable. I wish it was a couple inches longer as the base of my neck is exposed if I'm wearing it over my lower face. If it's that cold though I'll have my collar up, so not a real problem.
customer_reviews.author: MontanaRaccoon

customer_reviews.title: Primary winter neckwarmer
customer_reviews.text: This is a good add on for winter weather or snow related outdoor activities. White accessories go well with almost anything. Not intended for workouts. Also good for face covings. Washable.
customer_reviews.author: geo_study

customer_reviews.title: Super Soft and Warm
customer_reviews.text: I needed a neck warmer for a polar trip and loved the color of this one (I bought a matching hat too!). It's also super soft and fits great. This will be my go-to brand the next time I need fleece.
customer_reviews.author: Ana

customer_reviews.title: EXCEPTIONAL
customer_reviews.text: I layer this over my 12-in-1 Tough Headband for added warmth and its just as expected! I have had my last turtle fur neck warmer since I was 4 but the baby pink did not suite me any more so I purchased this one. The quality is exceptional its definitely a staple of mine while skiing!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't stretch out
customer_reviews.text: This fits really well and hasn't stretched out after many uses. Good warmth without a lot of bulk. I wear it pulled up to my nose under an an equestrian riding helmet. If you are in wind and below freezing I suggest getting a heavier weight. When it's in the teens and below (Fahrenheit) the wind cuts through. After a short time it did start to pill inside and out, not terribly, but irritating on the face.
customer_reviews.author: Rain

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! It keep me very warm at the NHL Winter Classic, which was pretty chilly (though not frigid) and raining. It never felt wet to the skin. It was ever so slightly snug, not snug to the point of discomfort, but I have a larger neck apparently. (I always need extenders on standard necklaces.) I wore it for hours and did not have to take it off due to discomfort. Would definitely purchase again!
customer_reviews.author: Cruzer

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality product that sheds
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed at the quality of this product. I wore it for the first day on a ski trip. The material started shedding right away and was all over my clothing, hair, body and basically anything I touched. It was disintegrating by the minute. By noon, I had to take it off. I purchased two of these, the other one for my husband, and they were both shedding heavily.
customer_reviews.author: ZW

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievable warmth.
customer_reviews.text: It's really hard to imagine how effectively this product produces soft, comforting warmth when you're outdoors. I would have never considered buying something like this, but had such a fervent recommendation from a guide I know that I thought I'd give one a try. I'm so glad I did. Best outdoor clothing purchase I've ever made!!
customer_reviews.author: Zounds!!

customer_reviews.title: It fits on the small size
customer_reviews.text: The width is too small. It was a little difficult to pull over the head. The fabric feels good but not stretchy enough. It feels snug when on the neck and feels warm. I was looking for a neck warmer with a wider width so can be comfortable when I pull over the nose with an option to wear it as a hat.
customer_reviews.author: K. chu

customer_reviews.title: Warm AND Soft!
customer_reviews.text: I love this! It is so soft and not too bulky, yet keeps my neck warm! The gray color is nice as well, not too light or too dark,,,, really recommend this neck warmer!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great color, very warm and soft, but too tight
customer_reviews.text: I love Turtle Fur neck warmers and have 2 older single layers and an double layer which fit perfectly. The new ones I bought - green, red and purple double layer are too snug. I am 5'4" tall and weigh 133lbs with a thin neck and small head. I gave the red and purple as gifts. I love the green color and wear it all the time on cold days, just wish it wasn't so tight.
customer_reviews.author: Spike

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality!
customer_reviews.text: This is great—wear it around your neck, pull it up over your nose, or fold it in half & wear it like a headband to keep your ears warm. It’s a great little item to have in your winter wardrobe.
customer_reviews.author: Judy K.

customer_reviews.title: Favorite piece of winter gear
customer_reviews.text: This is my best winter gear! It’s much better than a scarf. It keeps cold out and it’s wide enough to pull over my nose. I’ve given this to several friends and family and they all love it too! I walk my dogs every day and never stayed warm enough in the Winter until I bought this. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Mellie F

customer_reviews.title: Warm but not great
customer_reviews.text: Wore it skiing. It is very warm. Didn’t have a problem with it digging up my glasses too bad. Only down fall is that it’s two ply and they don’t stay together. When you get it up over your nose you wind up “eating” the inner layer. Will I use it again? Yes. Will I buy another one? Probably not this style.
customer_reviews.author: T Jack

customer_reviews.title: Love my furs!
customer_reviews.text: I love my Turtle Furs. I've only owned two in the 20ish years I've been using them on the slopes. They are soft and durable. Easy to pull up over your face for those colder/breezy days. I love that they come in a variety of colors too! I own a very light blue one and a charcoal colored one. The light blue one, which I got nearly 2 decades ago, looks identical to my charcoal one that I just got last year in terms of the durability of feel of the fleece (aka it's still like new). I've worn them in all types of conditions and have never felt like I needed anything thicker. Highly highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Jen F

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my little dog
customer_reviews.text: I have one of these that I use and it keeps me ultra warm. As my dog ages, she is shivering. I slipped one of these on her and voila! it took care of her cold body. It fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: does its job
customer_reviews.text: it keeps your neck and face warm during harsh winter weather but after few weeks of use.. the cotton ball started to form on the surface not that its bad don't think it will last long with material wearing out already the turtle logo on the gater rubs against skin sometime but its aight
customer_reviews.author: KBW

customer_reviews.title: Fits tight
customer_reviews.text: This particular turtle fur neckwarmer was made in China of 100% polyester and is not as good a product as the 100% acrylic turtle fur. Granted, it is of quality construction but it fits tighter, almost too tight whereas the other material fits better. Maybe this "adult" sized warmer was sized to a average Chinese adult neck rather than an American neck? Unless this product becomes available in "large adult" size, it just fits too tight for me. Maybe it will stretch out with use.
customer_reviews.author: Jess King

customer_reviews.title: I'm disappointed in the tightness of this item
customer_reviews.text: I'm disappointed in the tightness of this item. I'm a woman with a medium-size head, I believe, but getting this on is ridiculous. It's so tight, in spite of the fact I have very short, straight hair. Naturally it messes up my hair. What I do love is the warmth and softness of the turtle fur. I can't decide if I'll send it back, since I'll probably only need it 2-3 times each winter when I do errands in the cold. It would be nice if the manufacturer made this just one inch wider or made it in two sizes--one a little larger for people like me.
customer_reviews.author: Cat Lover

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend
customer_reviews.text: I got the sea glass color to match my bike. I already have it in black and have ordered one for my dad a couple of years ago. it's perfect for the cold and even after many washes they still hold their shape! I love these and am highly recommending them!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: It is warm, however...
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a neck warmer for those cold morning walks, and especially operating my snow thrower. I followed the instructions and washed it cold water, and I let it air dry. I have an average neck size, and this seems to tight for me. It reminds me of wearing a necktie that is too tight. I just don't like the feeling of being choked
customer_reviews.author: D. anderson

customer_reviews.title: Extremely soft, keeps your neck and face VERY warm.
customer_reviews.text: This has survived 2 winters and counting. I'll end up getting another pair regardless, as I found myself stealing these from my wife any chance I could get when it came time to do anything out in the blizzards. Extremely soft and comfy, very durable and much warmer than I expected. don't waste your time shopping around, this is perfect for keeping warm in the coldest and windiest of winter days.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Turtle Fur neck warmer made in China I thought it was US made.
customer_reviews.text: I bought a neck warmer for winter skiing. I thought Turtle Fur was supposedly made in VT however the tag says "made in China" - just keeps shedding all over everything; even after it's been washed. Sorry I bought it. What a mess.
customer_reviews.author: Judy Withers

customer_reviews.title: Turtle Softness
customer_reviews.text: Love this product!! turtle fur has been around a long time! Have tried others nothing compares to the softness of the turtle fur to keep my neck warm for the cold winters! Was so glad to find on amazon! Great price!!
customer_reviews.author: Mary Jane

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Arrived as promised. Quality was much better than my first Turtle! I had to replace it when someone borrowed and did not return. I will purchase more of these for Christmas gifts. It does not get too cold here in Tucson, AZ but riding my motorcycle to other destinations during Fall and Winter this is a MUST HAVE for every rider!
customer_reviews.author: Cyndi Foster

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work for me.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted another gaiter since my Columbia is getting worn out. I wear a gaiter when I'm plowing the driveway so I don't get windchill on my skin. I don't like this at all. It's super tight trying to get it on, and it smashes my nose. I have a Russian nose, but it's not HUGE. I don't care for the lack of being able to move in it, either. Not as comfortable as the Columbia..so back to buy another one from Columbia.
customer_reviews.author: Basha Vic

customer_reviews.title: Great broduct
customer_reviews.text: Wow this is soft And comfortable I work out side and keeps my neck warm no wind gets through it and it does not make me sweat its perfect
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super toasty and warm!!!
customer_reviews.text: This fleece is amazing! San Diego,CA can get down in the low 40s and high thirties in the winter (haha) so this is perfect. I have the Turtle Fur ear warmers as well and they are just what I need. Super soft!
customer_reviews.author: It'sMe

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I grew up wearing this brand and I bought this one for my daughter. They’ve always been great and last forever.
customer_reviews.author: A. F. Rab

customer_reviews.title: Warm, but sheds like crazy
customer_reviews.text: I've had this gaiter for a few weeks now. It is very warm, which is good. However it sheds like crazy. It looks like it will fall apart soon. Every time I put it on or take it off it leaves black "fuzzies" all over my face and clothes. I'll keep it for shoveling the driveway (until it disintegrates), but I won't wear it out. I wouldn't buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bobbled after first use
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in this - wore it for the first time skiing and it bobbled really badly. I hoped that after washing it would improve but it hasn't. Very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Wee Slavey

customer_reviews.title: Too tight
customer_reviews.text: The fabric is comfortable, but it's too small for my neck. I tried stretching it as much as I could without damaging it, but even then it was too tight. I have a moderately large neck (17"), but it's too large for this item.
customer_reviews.author: CR

customer_reviews.title: Soft and warm!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for skiing in the northeast, and I love it. On windy days, I put it on under my jacket and pull it up to keep my neck warm and to prevent wind from going down into my jacket. The fleece is very soft and comfortable. Northeast skiing is not as cold as some other places so I don't know how it will perform in extreme cold, but for average days on the slopes it is great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The "turtle fur" sheds like crazy, so only buy this if you want ...
customer_reviews.text: The "turtle fur" sheds like crazy, so only buy this if you want your face and clothes covered with black particles.
customer_reviews.author: Harold A. Sloas, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: The fabric is so soft and does a great job keeping your neck and face warm
customer_reviews.text: This purchase saved me on the slopes. The fabric is so soft and does a great job keeping your neck and face warm. If you have a large neck it might be a bit snug but I think I have a normal size neck and it fit perfectly. You can lift it up over your mouth or nose if it's really cold outside. This is a great alternative to a scarf, I definitely recommend it for outdoor winter activities like skiing.
customer_reviews.author: AFay

customer_reviews.title: Just a hair constrictive
customer_reviews.text: A little too small. Feels like it’s choking me just a bit. Otherwise a very nice product.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff J. Ong

customer_reviews.title: Runs a little small.
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't get this to fit, had to give to a co-worker that is smaller. He really liked it.
customer_reviews.author: Kitchen geek

customer_reviews.title: I have a small head for a man, and ...
customer_reviews.text: I have a small head for a man, and this thing is hard for me to get on and it is tight around my face and neck, more so than it probably should be. I got it for my night patrols at work, so I wear a white dress shirt, and this thing also left black fuzz balls all over the collar the first several times I wore it.
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: I’m so glad I did
customer_reviews.text: Almost didn’t get this one as there were so many to choose from. Get the turtle fur. I’m so glad I did. Perfect for cold weather running over your nose neck and throat
customer_reviews.author: Corinne

customer_reviews.title: Very warm with a annoying flaw.
customer_reviews.text: I work outside and this thing has kept me very warm. The flaw is that it has an infinite amount of fuzz balls that will stick to your face. It most likely happens because I almost always have short facial hair stubble. I have washed it and it does still produce the fuzz balls. Something to consider if you are thinking about purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THESE! I got them in black and hot ...
customer_reviews.text: LOVE THESE! I got them in black and hot pink. They do kind of leave bits of fuzz on your clothes, maybe they just need a wash first, but for the price these are awesome! Perfect thickness and height and width!
customer_reviews.author: The Girl With Nine Lives

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Warmth
customer_reviews.text: Warm and soft, I have barely taken it off the last 2 weeks. Exactly as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Collins

customer_reviews.title: Very warm
customer_reviews.text: Kept my sons ears and face warm while waiting to compete for snowshoeing special Olympics. We were outside for hours on a mountain snow resort!
customer_reviews.author: Boymom3

customer_reviews.title: Not the real deal?
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 other gaters , this one is thinner, and tighter, actually smaller, although it has identical tags as the others, and arrived in different packaging.
customer_reviews.author: SAV

customer_reviews.title: Keep my neck warm keeps the desert dust out of my mug
customer_reviews.text: Keep my neck warm keeps the desert dust out of my mug
customer_reviews.author: michael cochran

customer_reviews.title: Warm but carhart is better.
customer_reviews.text: Very warm and comfy. Leaves a lot of lint on my face. I’ve washed it a bunch thinking it might help but makes it worse. Carhart makes a better one.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Its warm but poor quality.
customer_reviews.text: It keeps my face warm for sure I love that. The issue with the product is after wearing it only once the fabric began to fall apart. It feels as it was cheaply made and I get the fabric on my hair, ears and mouth. The durability of the material used is questionable.
customer_reviews.author: Jose

customer_reviews.title: Super cozy
customer_reviews.text: So crazy soft. Only thing I don’t like about these is the little logo turtle tag sewn on, it’s got corners that will stab you, very pokey.
customer_reviews.author: Dianna

customer_reviews.title: Love this neck warmer
customer_reviews.text: It’s soft light weight & very warm but not hot. It’s great as a doggie neck & ear protector too.
customer_reviews.author: Jane

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my neck super warm. I really like this product
customer_reviews.text: Keeps my neck super warm. I really like this product, it is just a bit of a hassle and to put on to remove and keeps messing up my hair. Probably incorporating a zipped aspect would make it perfect.
customer_reviews.author: TT

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: Have a handful of them. They do keep me much warmer all over.
customer_reviews.author: lilred

customer_reviews.title: Favorite Purchase of 2017
customer_reviews.text: This was easily my favorite purchase of 2017 from Amazon. It is snug but not too tight. I wear it while jogging in the frigid cold and it works really well. Sometimes too well, but then I just pull it down past my chin. I had pneumonia in November but was determined not to miss the Turkey Trot 5K and I swear this neck warmer was the only reason my lungs didn't give out.
customer_reviews.author: K. York

customer_reviews.title: A little small but works well.
customer_reviews.text: A little tight and short, and all one width so it wrinkles up on your neck. Otherwise, very soft, very warm and should work great in winter winds.
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: Warm but leaves lent fuzz
customer_reviews.text: Very warm, Very soft, Fits my big head, But the lent fuzz gets a bit annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Bubba Fat

customer_reviews.title: Keeps me nice and warm.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a neck warmer for the cold environment I work in (refrigerated production line). At first I was a bit skeptical about buying this since I couldn't try it on for size. I delayed in purchasing this and when I finally did I wished I hadn't waited so long. Sure it fit a bit snug at first, but after the third day, it stretched and got broken in. Now I couldn't imagine a work day without this.
customer_reviews.author: Denis A.

customer_reviews.title: Quite Warm
customer_reviews.text: This neck warmer is double layered and good for the coldest of the cold days but a bit warm and thick for most winter days. I wouldn't wear it for long walks on cold days because it's not as easy to breathe through as some others. But if you've got a wind chill of -20 or -30 and need to cover up going to the mailbox or into the grocery store, this is great and will protect you well.
customer_reviews.author: Frogtowner

customer_reviews.title: One size fits all
customer_reviews.text: It's one size fits all so it seems to fall off my face
customer_reviews.author: Timothy J Chaplock

customer_reviews.title: extremely comfy
customer_reviews.text: I use this gaiter riding my motorcycle in the winter and it is perfect. Also thick and comfy enough to sleep with as a lightshade too.
customer_reviews.author: DozerDude

customer_reviews.title: and not as easy to breathe through
customer_reviews.text: My mistake; I bought the double layer thinking it was the same as the one I was trying to replace (which was actually single layer) I prefer the single-layer one instead, which is longer and easier to breathe through. This one was a bit shorter than I expected, and not as easy to breathe through. ... but on the plus side as warm as it gets. A bit bulky if you want to put a neoprene ski mask over the top
customer_reviews.author: P. Gray

customer_reviews.title: Super warm.
customer_reviews.text: Great product, super warm! After last winter where it was always cold this was a life saver!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: When it's freezing I don't leave home without it.
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! It really does a great job where the scarf leaves off. It is super warm and protects you from freezing wind and snow. It's soft and goes on easy. My only complaint would be that it leaves fuzz on my face after it's been washed once.
customer_reviews.author: Captain Snackbar

customer_reviews.title: Quality lacking
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a Christmas gift for my daughter and she just used this past week on our ski trip. Didn’t hold up well at all. Instantly started pilling up and got on everything in the wash. Would return if they’d take it back.
customer_reviews.author: TTalew

customer_reviews.title: Warm and soft.
customer_reviews.text: Very warm, soft and comfortable to wear. Completely blocks the wind and cold, but is only water resistant. Excellent substitute for a scarf or muffler when required to wear a uniform or engaging in athletics.
customer_reviews.author: the.galloglach

customer_reviews.title: Great, super toasty soft neck warmer for running or just a blustery day
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing. Great for running in cold weather. Soft and warm. Kids love them too. I more often than not opt for this on cold day over a big bulky scarf. Would definitely recommend
customer_reviews.author: theoperadiva

customer_reviews.title: Very soft
customer_reviews.text: I use this to keep my neck warm while riding my motorcycle. Very soft, warm and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Susan K.

customer_reviews.title: Very minor--rides up a bit.
customer_reviews.text: I gave this to my Mom. She loves how it keeps her neck warm. Her only negative comment was that after wearing it for a long time, it does tend to ride up a bit. Not a big deal, she said.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda H.

customer_reviews.title: Better than a scarf - soft and effective.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent warmth - better than scarves. Soft, cozy double-layers really do the trick. This warmer is easily stretched to pull over my head while leaving my glasses in place - that's a big plus. I wash on cold and line dry. Have a couple colors now for every occasion.
customer_reviews.author: Non-fiction Addiction

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy it
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality. The material stain other light clothing. It is not Original Turtle neck fleece brand
customer_reviews.author: flor rojas

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, warm and very soft
customer_reviews.text: Very very warm and soft. I was very impressed when I tried this on. Still haven’t taken it out on the slopes but so far I am very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Mike T

product_meta.title: Turtle Fur Chelonia 150 Classic Fleece Double-Layer Neck Warmer
feature_bullets: BUILT FOR EVERY WINTER ADVENTURE: From skiing to snowboarding, running to hiking, or shoveling snow to snowball fights, you'll be warm with this gaiter on. Designed in the mountains of Vermont we've tested this to be warm in the coldest of weather.
EASY TO WEAR: Tube design is easy to pull on over your head and can be worn as a scarf or a face mask. One size fits most design makes this a great neck warmer for men or women.

SOFT & WARM: Made of 100% Polyester Chelonia 150 Fleece we are sure this will be the softest fleece you've ever felt. Double-Layer construction ensures that you are kept warm even as the temperature drops.

EASY CARE & PACKABLE: Machine washable in cold water, and just toss it in the dryer with no heat to have it clean and fresh for your next adventure. 9.75" square and only 3.1 ounces this neck warmer is easy to throw in your bag before your next trip to the mountain.
GIVE A HAT: When you buy this neck warmer and share a photo on social media with #projectwarmth and mention @turtlefur we will donate a hat to someone in need.
